com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain

Interface SecureCreditCard

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ManualEntryCardData

    public interface SecureCreditCard
    Sets of card data that move in/out of the SDK must implement this interface.

    The CardReaderManager will send up an object that implements SecureCreditCard when it detects a card swipe. Also, when taking a payment you can supply an object that implements SecureCreditCard (like the domain.ManualEntryCardData object, the SecureCreditCard object that CardReaderManager emitted during a swipe, or your own credit card object that implements SecureCreditCard).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  SecureCreditCard.DataSourceType
      An enum defining what the source of the data was
      static class  SecureCreditCard.EncryptionMode
      The type of encryption on this secure credit card.

    • Method Detail

      • getCardHoldersName

        java.lang.String getCardHoldersName()
        The card holder's name.
        Returns:
        A String containing the card holder's name.

      • getLastFourDigits

        java.lang.String getLastFourDigits()
        The last 4 digits of the credit card. For some cards, that is the only portion of the number that is available, for other cards (like manual entry credit cards) the entire number may be known.
        Returns:
        A string containing the last 4 digits.

      • getFirstFourDigits

        java.lang.String getFirstFourDigits()
        The first 4 digits are available with some card scanners.
        Returns:
        The first 4 digits of the card. This is not guaranteed. we return the valid digits if we know else the masked number will be returned.

      • getCVVNumber

        java.lang.String getCVVNumber()
        The CVV number of the credit card if known.
        Returns:
        A string containing the CVV number. Null if the CVV is not known.

      • getExpiryDate

        java.lang.String getExpiryDate()
        The expiry date of the credit card. The format of the string is as follows: "092019" represents September of the year 2019.
        Returns:
        A string containing the expiry date of the credit card.

      • getEncryptionMode

        SecureCreditCard.EncryptionMode getEncryptionMode()
        The encryption mode of this card.
        Returns:
        An EncryptionMode enum value.

      • getRawCardNumber

        java.lang.String getRawCardNumber()
        The full unencrypted card number. For some cards this value is not obtainable and may be null.
        Returns:
        Null if the data is not available, otherwise it's a string containing the card number.

      • getSecureData

        JSONObject getSecureData()
        Returns the JSON formatted secure data of the credit card.
        Returns:
        A JSONObject containing the secure credit card data. Please see additional documentation for the JSON format that is needed by the backend system.

      • getPostalCode

        java.lang.String getPostalCode()
        Return the postal code. Might not be known, in which case this will return null
        Returns:
        A String such as "26062". If unknown, this will return null.

      • copy

        SecureCreditCard copy()

      • isManualEntry

        boolean isManualEntry()

      • getDataSourceType

        SecureCreditCard.DataSourceType getDataSourceType()

      • getCardIssuer

        CardIssuer getCardIssuer()

      • isSignatureRequired

        boolean isSignatureRequired()
        Returns a boolean to indicate whether a signature is required or not in order to complete the transaction. NOTE: this is used mainly in case of EMV flow where the chip on the card and terminal decide whether a customer signature is required or not and the app is expected honor the same.
        Returns:
        : a boolean value indicating whether the customer signature is required or not.
